item.dc:creator: @I_Metal_I I Metal I
item.description:
@I_Metal_I wrote:

if (IsDead == true && NewHP <= 1) { ApplyDead(); } else { if (IronHpGame() == true) { ApplyDead2(); }

try it that way… basically what budda said but i cswitched it around… dont feel like making up a whole new code xD

item.source: Chaning what happens when you die if a boolean applies?

item.title: Chaning what happens when you die if a boolean applies?
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

That won’t work.
Do this:

if (IsDead == true && newHP <= 1) { if (IronHpGame) { ApplyDead2(); } else { ApplyDead(); } }

Read full topic
item.source: Chaning what happens when you die if a boolean applies?

item.title: Chaning what happens when you die if a boolean applies?
item.dc:creator: @LeScape_Pk LeScape Pk
item.description:
@LeScape_Pk wrote:

question, i have this

public boolean ApplyDead2() {
		if (IronHpGame() && IsDead == true) {
teleportToX = 3231;
teleportToY = 3925;
}
		return true;
}

and somewhere, lemme find it i put

if (IsDead == true && NewHP <= 1) {
			ApplyDead();
		} else if (IronHpGame() == true) {
			ApplyDead2();
		}

ok so when i die in the area it teles me there, but i still lose items, what do i edit?

Read full topic
item.source: Chaning what happens when you die if a boolean applies?

item.title: Chaning what happens when you die if a boolean applies?
item.dc:creator: @hippyss hippyss
item.description:
@hippyss wrote:

[quote=“Budda, post:11, topic:102076”][quote author=hippyss link=topic=146310.msg1393343#msg1393343 date=1180422742]

so, add that into applydead?x

Or make a duplicate apply dead with no remove item stuff.

Why do that when you can just add more to the:

[CODE]} else {

}[/CODE]

Part? C’mon, if you’re going to be making a proper mini-game, you have to think about this shit properly.
[/quote] Because i like seperate booleans + voids.

= longer loading time = more lag.[/quote] True i just find them easyer to edit.Thats all

Read full topic

item.title: Chaning what happens when you die if a boolean applies?
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

No.

In your ApplyDead() method add this:

if (IronHpGame()) { teleportToX = ####; teleportToY = ####; } else { teleportToX = NORMAL; teleportToY = NORMAL; }

Read full topic

item.title: Chaning what happens when you die if a boolean applies?
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

public boolean IronHpGame() { if (absX >= 3218 && absY >= 3937 && absX <= 3257 && absY <= 3955) { teleportToX = XCOORDS; teleportToY = YCOORDS; return true; else return false; }
Try that, not sure if it would work, I’ve never worked with booleans :\

Read full topic
item.source: Chaning what happens when you die if a boolean applies?

item.title: Chaning what happens when you die if a boolean applies?
item.dc:creator: @LeScape_Pk LeScape Pk
item.description:
@LeScape_Pk wrote:

i have this boolean

public boolean IronHpGame() {
if (absX >= 3218 && absY >= 3937 && absX <= 3257 && absY <= 3955)
return true;
else
return false;
}

How would i make it when that boolean applies, instead of dying like normal, you are teled into the waiting room, just use fake coords for now
ive tried adding an if to apply dead
etc
just please. tell me what to do
